results.title: Any time, any place
results.brief_description: This documentary presented by the United States National Parks Service, expresses concern that man has become separate from nature. While many humans still exist as they did centuries ago, modern man has built a wall against nature. Calls for teaching to inspire and regain an interest in nature. Suitable for Upper Primary and Secondary level students.
results.description: This documentary presented by the United States National Parks Service, expresses concern that man has become separate from nature. results.title: Anti-matter
results.creator_credit: Carlos Gutierrez-Mena, Lewis C. Hall and University of California, Los Angeles. Dept. of Physics
results.brief_description: This program explores the subject of anti-matter; its significance as a destructive process and the possibility of its constructive use. It explains matter, anti-matter and explores the possibility that large quantities of anti-matter exist in space.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Carlos Gutierrez-Mena, Lewis C. Hall and University of California, Los Angeles. Dept. of Physics

results.title: Antarctica: the unowned land
results.brief_description: Provides an introduction to Antarctica showing landforms, ice and animal life such as penguins and whales. Briefly touches on the impact of humans in the area. The program also spends some time studying the animal life in the Falkland Islands. No other credits available.

results.title: Antarctica
results.brief_description: New Zealand’s proximity to Antarctica has led to an active involvement in its scientific exploration since the late 50s. Antarctica has seen two historical periods- the early age of exploration and the age of scientific exploration. With the scarcity of natural resources will the next age be that of exploitation

results.title: Ansel Adams: photographer
results.creator_credit: David Myers and Larry Dawson Productions
results.brief_description: The work and philosophy of Ansel Adams, a gifted musician, writer and teacher as well as photographer, for which he is best known. A professional photographer must have an endless amount of equipment; cameras, lenses, tripods, light meters etc. Adams is seen shooting a beach scene and later in the dark room creating a picture. His work as an industrial photographer is also illustrated. Music played by Ansel Adams. Curator - The George Eastman House.

results.title: An Apple a day
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
Made before eating disorders were recognised as serious diseases, this documentary focuses on a hospital dietitian, a dentist and women in a dieting club as they discuss the evils of overeating. It also highlights the importance of good nutrition and regular exercise in maintaining a slender figure.

results.title: Caring for the mind
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
Details some of the stresses, strains and speed of modern living which have made mental illness a common occurrence. Types of treatment and care of the mentally ill are explained.

results.title: Three score years and ten
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”
Looks at some of the positive aspects of old age, and what can be done by the ag ed, their families, and society at large, to make the final years pleasant and contented ones. Intended for children aged 13-16 years.

results.title: Safe on the road
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
The number of road accidents resulting in death or severe injuries is increasing. Statistics of road accidents are given and the film stresses the need for responsible attitudes by all road users. The necessity for using all available safety precautions is emphasised.
